title: Clickhouse 'OpenTelemetry Support' can not write to jaeger-collector
body:
clickhouse-server(v21.9.5.16-stable) shows error:
```
2021.10.29 08:36:31.416694 [ 59 ] {} <Error> void DB::SystemLog<DB::OpenTelemetrySpanLogElement>::flushImpl(const std::vector<LogElement> &, uint64_t) [LogElement = DB::OpenTelemetrySpanLogElement]: Code: 86. DB::Exception: Received error from remote server /api/v2/spans. HTTP status code: 400 Bad Request, body: Cannot parse Content-Type: mime: no media type
: while writing suffix to view default.zipkin_spans. (RECEIVED_ERROR_FROM_REMOTE_IO_SERVER), Stack trace (when copying this message, always include the lines below):

0. DB::Exception::Exception(std::__1::basic_string<char, std::__1::char_traits<char>, std::__1::allocator<char> > const&, int, bool) @ 0x93a6a9a in /usr/bin/clickhouse
1. DB::assertResponseIsOk(Poco::Net::HTTPRequest const&, Poco::Net::HTTPResponse&, std::__1::basic_istream<char, std::__1::char_traits<char> >&, bool) @ 0xea933e3 in /usr/bin/clickhouse
2. DB::PushingToSinkBlockOutputStream::writeSuffix() @ 0x10b3207f in /usr/bin/clickhouse
3. DB::PushingToViewsBlockOutputStream::writeSuffix() @ 0x10b3b343 in /usr/bin/clickhouse
4. ? @ 0x10b3ea2f in /usr/bin/clickhouse
5. DB::runViewStage(DB::ViewRuntimeData&, std::__1::basic_string<char, std::__1::char_traits<char>, std::__1::allocator<char> > const&, std::__1::function<void ()>) @ 0x10b37122 in /usr/bin/clickhouse
6. DB::PushingToViewsBlockOutputStream::writeSuffix() @ 0x10b3b64d in /usr/bin/clickhouse
7. DB::SystemLog<DB::OpenTelemetrySpanLogElement>::flushImpl(std::__1::vector<DB::OpenTelemetrySpanLogElement, std::__1::allocator<DB::OpenTelemetrySpanLogElement> > const&, unsigned long) @ 0x10e60117 in /usr/bin/clickhouse
8. DB::SystemLog<DB::OpenTelemetrySpanLogElement>::savingThreadFunction() @ 0x10e5e060 in /usr/bin/clickhouse
9. ThreadFromGlobalPool::ThreadFromGlobalPool<DB::SystemLog<DB::OpenTelemetrySpanLogElement>::startup()::'lambda'()>(DB::OpenTelemetrySpanLogElement&&, DB::SystemLog<DB::OpenTelemetrySpanLogElement>::startup()::'lambda'()&&...)::'lambda'()::operator()() @ 0x10e5df16 in /usr/bin/clickhouse
10. ThreadPoolImpl<std::__1::thread>::worker(std::__1::__list_iterator<std::__1::thread, void*>) @ 0x93e7abf in /usr/bin/clickhouse
11. ? @ 0x93eb3a3 in /usr/bin/clickhouse
12. start_thread @ 0x9609 in /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libpthread-2.31.so
13. clone @ 0x122293 in /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc-2.31.so
 (version 21.9.5.16 (official build))
```
Depends on link: https://clickhouse.com/docs/zh/operations/opentelemetry/#integration-with-monitoring-systems
```
CREATE MATERIALIZED VIEW default.zipkin_spans
ENGINE = URL('http://simplest-collector.user01.svc.cluster.local:9411/api/v2/spans', 'JSONEachRow')
SETTINGS output_format_json_named_tuples_as_objects = 1,
    output_format_json_array_of_rows = 1 AS
SELECT
    lower(hex(reinterpretAsFixedString(trace_id))) AS traceId,
    lower(hex(parent_span_id)) AS parentId,
    lower(hex(span_id)) AS id,
    operation_name AS name,
    start_time_us AS timestamp,
    finish_time_us - start_time_us AS duration,
    cast(tuple('clickhouse'), 'Tuple(serviceName text)') AS localEndpoint,
    cast(tuple(
        attribute.values[indexOf(attribute.names, 'db.statement')]),
        'Tuple("db.statement" text)') AS tags
FROM system.opentelemetry_span_log
```
Set up jaeger as below:
```
jaeger-collector with options:
      collector.zipkin.host-port: ":9411"
      collector.zipkin.allowed-origins: "*"
```

Seems like clickhouse write to jaeger without header "content-type"?

title: Not able to query system.tables when MySQL database is unavailable
body:
When MySQL database is offline, query against `system.tables` will end up with an error like below:
```
Received exception from server (version 21.10.2):
Code: 1000. DB::Exception: Received from localhost:9000. DB::Exception: Exception: Connections to all replicas failed: <db>@<host>:<port> as user <user>. (POCO_EXCEPTION)
```
Due to this, clients like JDBC driver can no longer get list of tables, resulting a weird situation where all tables "disappeared":
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4270380/139179188-40de18ca-ca23-4dbb-963a-586065073533.png)
I didn't test but perhaps similar issue exists for other database engines.

Reproduce steps:
1. create mysql database
   ```sql
   create database m engine=MySQL('<host>:<port>', '<db>', '<user>', '<password>')
   ```
2. shutdown mysql server
3. query system.tables
    ```sql
    select * from system.tables
    ```

Workaround:
```sql
-- tedious to query external database one by one as we don't know which one has issue
select * from system.tables where database != 'm'
```

Expected behavior:
* warnings in log showing the MySQL database was not available
* return all tables except those not able to access

title: Insert Exception fails to specify which column caused the exception
body:
(you don't have to strictly follow this form)

**Describe the unexpected behaviour**

Error message does not specify the column name generating the failed insert. I do, however, get an essay of messages, none of which I can action as a user of the clickhouse.

I'm working with data where most fields can be null. Some of those fields, I apply `LowCardinality()` to and it helps immensely with query performance. I attempted `Nullable(LowCardinality(String))` and was told the DDL was invalid, so I went with `LowCardinality(Nullable(String))` and everything worked. For a while.  I just upgraded to 21.10. And now I'm getting failures.

My issue is not about the failure, it's about the Error message.

```
# See below for full error message
ClickHouse error: Internal Server Error (Code: 44. DB::Exception: ColumnLowCardinality cannot be inside Nullable column: ...
```

**The error does NOT contain the name of the column that caused the exception.** Because of this, I'm completely at a loss for how to better contribute anything meaningful to this bug report. 

**How to reproduce**
* Which ClickHouse server version to use

21.10

* `CREATE TABLE` statements for all tables involved

```
    CREATE OR REPLACE TABLE default.logs_local ON CLUSTER '{cluster}'
    (
        aiv Nullable(String),
        ar LowCardinality(Nullable(String)),
        as Nullable(UInt32),
        at Nullable(String),
        at_pc Nullable(String),
        av Nullable(String),
        b UInt32 DEFAULT 0,
        bui Nullable(String),
        c Nullable(String),
        ca LowCardinality(Nullable(String)),
        cc LowCardinality(Nullable(String)),
        ci UInt8 DEFAULT 0,
        cv LowCardinality(Nullable(String)),
        dms UInt32,
        h LowCardinality(Nullable(String)),
        i String,
        id String,
        it LowCardinality(Nullable(String)),
        j LowCardinality(Nullable(String)),
        k UInt16,
        li Nullable(String),
        m LowCardinality(Nullable(String)),
        n LowCardinality(Nullable(String)),
        org LowCardinality(Nullable(String)),
        p Nullable(String),
        r Nullable(String),
        rd Nullable(String),
        rh Nullable(String),
        s UInt16,
        t DateTime,
        tags Array(Nullable(String)),
        ttl Nullable(UInt16),
        u Nullable(String),
        uc LowCardinality(Nullable(String)),
        xr LowCardinality(Nullable(String))
    )
    Engine=Distributed('{cluster}', 'default', 'logs', rand())
```
* Sample data causing error below

```
[
    [0] {
        aiv     undef,
        ar      undef,
        as      397907,
        at      undef,
        at_pc   undef,
        av      undef,
        b       11617,
        bui     undef,
        c       "ANONYMIZED",
        ca      undef,
        cc      "US",
        ci      1,
        cv      "VALID",
        dms     1,
        h       "ANONYMIZED",
        i       "104.192.231.9",
        id      "I4BOw3wB6beiMM6rOwCN",
        it      "business",
        j       "6fa3244afc6bb6f9fad207b6b52af26b",
        k       17372,
        li      undef,
        m       "GET",
        n       "ANONYMIZED",
        org     865,
        p       "ANONYMIZED",
        r       "ANONYMIZED",
        rd      "ANONYMIZED",
        rh      "ANONYMIZED",
        s       200,
        t       "2021-10-27 19:50:56",
        tags    "[]",
        ttl     52,
        u       "ANONYMIZED",
        uc      "ANONYMIZED",
        xr      "OC6Z2SK6IvBpNC98R7"
    }
]
```

**Expected behavior**

Column name to be present saying "invalid data for column 'x': <words>".

**Error message and/or stacktrace**

```
ClickHouse error: Internal Server Error (Code: 44. DB::Exception: ColumnLowCardinality cannot be inside Nullable column: while executing 'FUNCTION if(isNull(_dummy_0) : 3, defaultValueOfTypeName('LowCardinality(Nullable(String))') :: 2, _CAST(_dummy_0, 'LowCardinality(Nullable(String))') :: 4) -> if(isNull(_dummy_0), defaultValueOfTypeName('LowCardinality(Nullable(String))'), _CAST(_dummy_0, 'LowCardinality(Nullable(String))')) Nullable(String) : 1': While executing ValuesBlockInputFormat. (ILLEGAL_COLUMN) (version 21.10.2.15 (official build)))
        INSERT INTO logs_local ( aiv, ar, as, at, at_pc, av, b, bui, c, ca, cc, ci, cv, dms, h, i, id, it, j, k, li, m, n, org, p, r, rd, rh, s, t, tags, ttl, u, uc, xr ) VALUES at /usr/local/share/perl5/ClickHouse.pm line 229.
```


**Additional context**

A snail can sleep for three years.  (That probably helps as much as this error message helps me)

The bulletproof vest was actually invented by a pizza delivery guy from Detroit USA, after he was shot twice on the job. (Also as helpful, but also more interesting than the above error message from Clickhouse)

title: groupBitmapMerge slow. how to pre-aggregate bitmap?
body:
I use materialized views to convert the detailed data to a bitmap structure, writing 1 million at a time to dc.detail_table. However, the query is slow, and most of the time is found when multiple rows are merged into one (see the log below). Is there any way to aggregate multiple rows of data into one row ahead of time? Here is my table structure and materialized view. There are 900 million elements in a Bitmap

```sql
CREATE TABLE dc.detail_table on cluster datacenter
(
    `name` String,
    `u` UInt32,
    `value` String
)
ENGINE = ReplicatedMergeTree('path', '{replica}')
PARTITION BY name
ORDER BY (value)
SETTINGS index_granularity = 8192;

CREATE TABLE dc.agg_table on cluster datacenter
(
    `name` String,
    `value` String,
    `u`  AggregateFunction(groupBitmap, UInt32)
)
ENGINE = ReplicatedMergeTree('path', '{replica}')
PARTITION BY name
ORDER BY (name, value)
SETTINGS index_granularity = 128;

CREATE MATERIALIZED VIEW IF NOT EXISTS dc.view  to dc.agg_table
AS 
SELECT 
name,
value,
groupBitmapState(user_id) AS u
FROM dc.detail_table
GROUP BY name, value;
```

```shell
root@ck:/# clickhouse-client --port 9000 --user default --password default -h 10.100.10.10 --send_logs_level=trace <<< "SELECT multiIf(tag.value = 0, 'unkown', tag.value = 1, 'men', tag.value = 2, 'women', '') AS key, groupBitmapMerge(u) AS group_by_users FROM dc.agg_table AS tag WHERE tag.name = 'sex' GROUP BY key;" > /dev/null
```

#25969
cc: @kssenii

title: Hope the `Map(String,Object)` data type is expected to be officially compatible
body:
I hope the Map(String,JsonObject) data type can be officially compatible, for example, my data is as follows:
```json
{
    "apiVersion": "6.0",
    "version": "1.10.2",
    "deviceId": "16",
    "brand": "mobile",
    "deviceModel": "Mozilla/5.0 /4.0 Chrome/83.0.4103.106",
    "cpu": "",
    "resolution": "384*792",
    "uuid": "38bd9e54e1***42b5d3d0b7c",
    "eventId": "webrtc",
    "arg1": "usg_http_refreshToken",
    "arg2": "",
    "arg3": "944a846c2****6cca1d9c7d82d7",
    "args": {
        "url": "xxx.xxx.com/v1/usg/acs/token",
        "responseCode": "200",
        "isSuccess": true
    },
    "timestampTz": "2021-10-27 11:06:28.601 +0800"
}
```
In this scenario, the args field in my table can only be defined as String, select like: **JSONExtractString(args, "url")** / **JSONExtractInt(args,"responseCode")** / **JSONExtractBool(args, "isSuccess")**, but in SQL is not elegant, compared to Map type can use **args['url']** way more succinctly, with presto we can get the fields directly like **args.url** / **args.responseCode** / **args.isSuccess**.
It is also unclear whether there is a significant difference between the performance of the **JSONExtract*** function with **String** type storage and the underlying performance of the **Map** type storage.
Expect official compatibility with JsonObject types, such data compatibility is the best.

title: OSS zero copy replication
body:
> A clear and concise description of what is the intended usage scenario is.

**Zero-copy replication for ReplicatedMergeTree over OSS storage**

> Detailed description / Documentation draft.

**Zero-copy replication over OSS storage**

title: NAS zero copy replication
body:
**Reasons for the proposal**
> I saw the new feature **'Separation of storage and compute'** in roadmap 2021 but it only support S3 and HDFS filesystem, i want to extend this so that it can support zero copy replication on **NAS**(Network Attached Storage). 
A NAS system is a storage device connected to a network that allows storage and retrieval of data from a centralized location for authorized network users and heterogeneous clients, it means that different users on different ECS(Elastic Container Service)  can access NAS just like local disk. But now on clickhouse, we still need to copy data though the data path is the same one using NAS.

**Use case**

> Different Clickhouse server have the same data path which is using NAS, so the data path can be accessed by different server. As NAS is infinitely scalable, we can add servers to improve computing performance.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

>Clickhouse cluster will synchronize two types of data: metadata in memory and part data on disk, if we have the same data path, we can only  synchronize metadata in cluster.

title: prefer_global_in_and_join=1 DB::Exception: Unknown table function tuple
body:
when 
```
set prefer_global_in_and_join=1;
set distributed_product_mode='global';
```
execute sqldate_dim is a distributed table
```
select count(*) from date_dim where d_year in (1999, 1999 + 1, 1999 + 2, 1999 + 3);
```
got this:
```
Received exception from server (version 21.8.5):
Code: 46. DB::Exception: Received from localhost:9000. DB::Exception: Unknown table function tuple: While processing d_year IN (1999, 1999 + 1, 1999 + 2, 1999 + 3).
```
however, use `d_year in (1999, 2000, 2001, 2002)` is ok, for example:
```
select count(*) from date_dim where d_year in (1999, 2000, 2001, 2002);
```

**How to reproduce**
* ClickHouse server version 21.8.5

title: Multi-table JOIN Code: 47, e.displayText() = DB::Exception: Missing columns

labels.name: potential bug
labels.description: To be reviewed by developers and confirmed/rejected.

body:
Here are the steps to redo the problem

First built table
create DATABASE if not exists smartbimpp;
create table `smartbimpp`.`avhnzf9rr2vuyesdvryc6w`(`B` Nullable(String),`B` Nullable(Int64)) Engine=Log;
create table `smartbimpp`.`m1nckbdef438o9em38zepg`(`A` Nullable(String),`B` Nullable(String),`AB` Nullable(Int64),`` Nullable(Int64)) Engine=Log;
create table `smartbimpp`.`3qcnfud0fy4lbircffaduw`(`A` Nullable(String),`A` Nullable(Int64)) Engine=Log;

Then execute the following statement

SELECT
	`m1nckbdef438o9em38zepg`.`B` AS `B`,
	`m1nckbdef438o9em38zepg`.`AB` AS `AB2`
FROM
	`smartbimpp`.`3qcnfud0fy4lbircffaduw` `3qcnfud0fy4lbircffaduw` 
RIGHT JOIN `smartbimpp`.`m1nckbdef438o9em38zepg` `m1nckbdef438o9em38zepg` ON
	`3qcnfud0fy4lbircffaduw`.`A` = `m1nckbdef438o9em38zepg`.`A`
LEFT JOIN `smartbimpp`.`avhnzf9rr2vuyesdvryc6w` `avhnzf9rr2vuyesdvryc6w` ON
	`m1nckbdef438o9em38zepg`.`B` = `avhnzf9rr2vuyesdvryc6w`.`B`


ClickHouse exception, code: 47, host: 10.10.111.129, port: 8123; Code: 47, e.displayText() = DB::Exception: Missing columns: 'AB' while processing query: 'SELECT A AS --3qcnfud0fy4lbircffaduw.A, AB, m1nckbdef438o9em38zepg.A AS --m1nckbdef438o9em38zepg.A, B AS --m1nckbdef438o9em38zepg.B FROM smartbimpp.3qcnfud0fy4lbircffaduw AS 3qcnfud0fy4lbircffaduw ALL RIGHT JOIN
smartbimpp.m1nckbdef438o9em38zepg AS m1nckbdef438o9em38zepg ON --3qcnfud0fy4lbircffaduw.A = --m1nckbdef438o9em38zepg.A', required columns: 'A' 'AB' 'm1nckbdef438o9em38zepg.A' 'B', maybe you meant: '['A']' '['A']', joined columns: 'm1nckbdef438o9em38zepg.A' 'B' 'm1nckbdef438o9em38zepg.AB' 'm1nckbdef438o9em38zepg.' (version 21.9.5.16 (official build))

title: More functions for `Map` data type
body:
Idea after conversation with [cLoki](https://github.com/lmangani/cLoki).

`mapReplace(map1, map2)` - replaces values for keys in map1 with the values of the corresponding keys in map2; adds keys from map2 that don't exist in map1.

Higher order functions: `mapFilter`, and even `mapMap`.
They can take a lambda function with k, v pair as arguments.

title: RabbitMQ engine truncates the last character
body:
(you don't have to strictly follow this form)

**Describe the unexpected behaviour**
I am using [pmacct](https://github.com/pmacct/pmacct) to stream network flow data via RabbitMQ to ClickHouse.

The data generated from pmacct in RabbitMQ looks like this when I request a message from the RabbitMQ web management:

Exchange: `pmacct`
Routing Key: `acct`
Properties: `delivery_mode: 2` & `content_type: application/json`
Payload:
```json
{"event_type": "purge", "as_src": 1234, "as_dst": 0, "as_path": "", "local_pref": 100, "med": 0, "peer_as_dst": 0, "ip_src": "<redacted ipv6>", "ip_dst": "<redacted ipv6>", "port_src": 443, "port_dst": 41930, "ip_proto": "tcp", "tos": 0, "stamp_inserted": "2021-10-26 15:20:00", "stamp_updated": "2021-10-26 15:23:14", "packets": 2, "bytes": 1216, "writer_id": "default_amqp/449206"}
```

I created the RabbitMQ engine table with:
```sql
create table pmacct.ingest (json String) engine = RabbitMQ settings rabbitmq_host_port = '10.10.3.8:5672', rabbitmq_exchange_name = 'pmacct', rabbitmq_routing_key_list = 'acct', rabbitmq_exchange_type = 'direct', rabbitmq_persistent = 1, rabbitmq_format = 'LineAsString'
```

SELECT-ing the data from that table gives me:
```
{"event_type": "purge", "as_src": 1234, "as_dst": 0, "as_path": "", "local_pref": 100, "med": 0, "peer_as_dst": 0, "ip_src": "<redacted ipv6>", "ip_dst": "<redacted ipv6>", "port_src": 443, "port_dst": 41930, "ip_proto": "tcp", "tos": 0, "stamp_inserted": "2021-10-26 15:20:00", "stamp_updated": "2021-10-26 15:23:14", "packets": 2, "bytes": 1216, "writer_id": "default_amqp/449206"
```
Where it is missing the `}` at the end, producing invalid JSON. Also, creating the table with `JSON` as `rabbitmq_format` does not work, SELECT-ing data from it yields the error: `DB::Exception: Format JSON is not suitable for input: While executing SourceFromInputStream.`, maybe because of the invalid JSON? Does ClickHouse truncate the last character because it is expecting a newline character?

My current workaround is adding the `}` back to each line with `concat()` in a MATERIALIZED VIEW:
```sql
CREATE MATERIALIZED VIEW ingest_mv TO data AS
SELECT
    JSONExtractString(concat(json, '}'), 'event_type') AS event_type,
    JSONExtractInt(concat(json, '}'), 'as_src') AS as_src,
    JSONExtractInt(concat(json, '}'), 'as_dst') AS as_dst,
    JSONExtractString(concat(json, '}'), 'as_path') AS as_path,
    JSONExtractInt(concat(json, '}'), 'local_pref') AS local_pref,
    JSONExtractInt(concat(json, '}'), 'med') AS med,
    JSONExtractInt(concat(json, '}'), 'peer_as_dst') AS peer_as_dst,
    IPv6StringToNum(JSONExtractString(concat(json, '}'), 'ip_src')) AS ip_src,
    IPv6StringToNum(JSONExtractString(concat(json, '}'), 'ip_dst')) AS ip_dst,
    JSONExtractInt(concat(json, '}'), 'port_src') AS port_src,
    JSONExtractInt(concat(json, '}'), 'port_dst') AS port_dst,
    JSONExtractString(concat(json, '}'), 'ip_proto') AS ip_proto,
    JSONExtractInt(concat(json, '}'), 'tos') AS tos,
    parseDateTime32BestEffortOrZero(JSONExtractString(concat(json, '}'), 'stamp_inserted')) AS stamp_inserted,
    parseDateTime32BestEffortOrZero(JSONExtractString(concat(json, '}'), 'stamp_updated')) AS stamp_updated,
    JSONExtractInt(concat(json, '}'), 'packets') AS packets,
    JSONExtractInt(concat(json, '}'), 'bytes') AS bytes,
    JSONExtractString(concat(json, '}'), 'writer_id') AS writer_id
FROM ingest;
```

There is another issue for me: After dropping the MATERIALIZED VIEW, the RabbitMQ table does not get filled anymore. SELECT-ing data from the RabbitMQ table says `0 rows in set.` and the messages start filling up in the RabbitMQ queue. I have to drop the RabbitMQ engine table aswell and re-create it, then I am able to SELECT message again. Also, ClickHouse sometimes crashes while dropping the view, as seen in https://github.com/ClickHouse/ClickHouse/issues/29315 with the exact stack trace.

Versions are:
Clickhouse 21.4.6.55-1
RabbitMQ 3.8.22-1
